The shower is also so small that apparently amenities like a place to put your soap and razor can't be included. The option would be to put your soap on the less then clean shower floor, stick your rear out through the curtain in order to have enough room to bend down and get it, etc. There was of course no hair dryer, either. The front desk gave us the one leaking, rusty iron they have to borrow- we had to walk down and back up something like 4 flights of stairs to get it as they would not bring it up. There was no ironing board. We had to use the bed to iron on. We lived in New York City for many years, and actually like good use of small space without unnecessary extras. However, this was so bad that we left the next morning, flagging down a taxi in cold, pouring rain to stay at a friend's in Park Slope Brooklyn and commute 40 minutes in to the client's venue everyday rather than continue staying at this miserable establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMunky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in April and had a great time. The staff were friendly when we booked in and the room was big with lovely comfy beds and very clean. The hotel was in a great location for us. We loved the Lower East Side and Little Italy areas - both had great bars and restaurants. The subway was close by and was quick, cheap (especially for us coming from London) and convenient. I'd definitely stay at the Sohotel again. It doesn't have loads of amenities (and in New York who wants to spend hours in a hotel room anyway?) but it was very good value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tdyer
Reviews.Content: The first problem was that they told me I wasn't registered and the confirmation number was not the kind of numbering they used. I had to fire up the laptop and physically show them the confirmation before they agreed that I was registered. Guess they don't know what they're confirmation numbers look like. I almost got a parking ticket because this process took so long to resolve. Had a kindly meter person give us a break. Then, one person at the desk told me they didn't know of any parking lots in the area where I could get a break on parking, even though this was advertised when I booked the room. Eventually, someone told me how I could get a reduced parking rate. Then, they booked me in a room over a bar or club that played really loud music until 2am. I mean REALLY loud. When I told the front desk about this they told me they'd call the place to "keep it down". Of course this never happened. Then early the next morning I was awoken by the street noise and the crowd of twenty somethings next door talking/yelling. Just horrible. Oh, didn't mention the fact that our view was a bunch of discarded construction junk piled up on scaffold next to our window.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed / Wanted to leave 1 minute after walking in!”
Reviews.Author: pam0119
Reviews.Content: First of all, no elevator. The only way my computer would work, was to sit in the hallway to get a good signal! Coffee was suppose to be in the lobby, only 2 of our 4 days was there ever coffee. They made one pot, if you did not get there by 7:30, it was gone. The 2 days I was there early enough, there was only powdered cream, no sugar of any kind. I would ask the girls at the desk, who looked at me like I was asking for a tennis bracelet, but only sugar! The answer was, "if its not there, we dont have it". Our room was not even 8x8. You could not walk around the bed at all. This was it for 4 days! Also, the outside was under constuction, so no view. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A chaotic mess-the Sohotel”
Reviews.Author: lisette36
Reviews.Content: March 19,2008 My daughter and I had one horrible night at this terrible hotel. It is hard to point out the worse part of this night but I will say that it was our next door "neighbor" At midnight they decided to have a party with their door open and a CD player blasting. After an hour and I suppose someone got up from bed and went to the front desk. Yes, ! there was no phone in the room. We had no cell phone so we felt like prisoners. When we arrived a "worker" was in our room watching Telemundo TV sitting on the bed, telling us the room was not ready though we had a key.. no kidding and he was hanging around us in a spooky way. Everywhere we went, we would see this spooky though pleasant Ichobod Crane. To get to the lobby you had to walk up a lot of stairs. No elevator. I read that this is the oldest hotel in NYC. This is not worth the almost 200 a night I paid to be sleepless in NYC. It is also in an iffy neighborhood. The Bowery which though is being gentrifid is not quite there yet. Don't go there if you hate loud noise and no way to contact the front desk without a cell phone. On a positive note, the staff is pleasant (even Mr Crane) though unprofessional and the lobby is not unpleasant. and it is pretty clean. Stay away is my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: SarahHLeicester
Reviews.Content: We were checked into a room that had not been cleaned from the previous occupants. The room was not nearly as nice as the pictures on the website and we paid for a superior room, so who knows what rooms they took the pictures of for the website. We left our luggage and returned later to a clean room but the heating pipes were on full blast and the room was a sauna. The windows are in pretty bad shape too so the room was very noisy from passers by and traffic all night. In addition there is scaffolding outside the windows so whilst we stayed on a Saturday night we didn't get any further disturbance - I would imagine weekdays would be worse. There is posters up warning you of workman noise from 8am!! but they do not tell you before you book and arrive.

Reviews.Title: “not a good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Shoba79
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 other friends stayed at the hotel for two nights. We stayed in a room with 3 beds. I assume the hotel was extra clean as it smelt of bleach, not the most pleasing smell out there. We arrived extremely early, so they allowed us to keep our bags/luggages in the closet, but wouldn't let us check in until 3:00 PM, which was fine with us. The hotel does not have any elevators, so when we did check in, we had to carry our luggage up 2 flights of stairs, good excercise I guess! Not at all accessible for a person with a disabilty. The two horrible experience was being woken up. On Saturday we were woken up at 3:00 AM as the people next door to us blasted the TV and were screaming and having a good time I assume. They were doing everything except sleeping!!!! We had to complain at the front desk and he came down and asked them to quiet down. They turn the volume down...oh let's say 2 notches, still very loud and then someone decided to go take a shower.......the noise of the running water kept us up for an hour, until everyone decided to shut up, stop taking showers and then only we could finally get some sleep. The next horrible experience we had was being woken up at 8:00 AM!!!!! on Monday morning. The hotel decided to do contruction in the room next to ours without giving us any notice or warning. It was not fun being woken up by saws, hammers, drills and every other power tool imaginable thinking the hotel was gonna collapse on us. When we went to complain, we just got a door slammed in our face from the contruction crew. Someone should teach them some manners. The other bad thing, was the toilets clogged easily, needless to say, that was very yuckyyyyyyy and there were stains on the toilet seats. A cleaning lady also walked into our room and appologized as she thought the room was supposed to be empty. So that was basically our experience.....not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kbarnes26
Reviews.Content: I read so many mixed reviews about Sohotel I was almost nervous checking in! Fortunately I was prepared that there are no elevators and some of the rooms are small. Knowing that I found it to be an amazing experience!! The hotel has so much character because it is so old yet it is amazingly clean! The staff is incredible! From refrigerating our left overs to storing our luggage as well as happy to accomodate us with a late check out I can't say enough about the staff! Every time we walked in or out we were greeted with countless smiles and friendly faces! The location of this hotel is AWESOME! Although we are from NY we were not familiar with that area at all. You are in Chinatown more so than Soho. Little Italy is 2 blocks away. Nolita is about 5 blocks away. There are so many different types of bars and restaurants in just a few blocks radius the choices are endless! Soho is close too as well as the village. If you are looking for an upscale 5 star hotel DO NOT COME HERE. If you are looking for a clean, friendly environment in an awesome location for the BEST price in NYC BOOK IT!!!! My husband and I for a weekend away without the kids would not hesitate to come back here!!

Reviews.Title: “Cant Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: MrsT513
Reviews.Content: The Sohotel was wonderful. The rooms were beautiful, the location was perfect especially for shopping. The bathrooms were great, they looked to be newly remodeled with hot water and very clean. Go to the web site and look at the pics. The hotel looks just like that. And to top it all off the staff is very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. All in all us 4 women from Cincinnati were very pleased to have found our New York home. Thanks Julio for helping us with all of our luggage!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay......”
Reviews.Author: abthacker
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter spent the weekend at this hotel and was very pleased! We flew up to NY to do some shopping and this hotel is in a great location for anything.So much is in walking distance and if you dont want to walk a taxi is always close.The staff at this hotel was friendly,helpful,and very courtious! I recommend this place for a home away from home in NY! I will be going back up to NY as a weekend is not enough time to see everything,and I will stay at sohotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: neil7545
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a business trip to Boston, thought it would be nice to spend the weekend in New York. We finished our business early so phoned the hotel and asked if we could get the two rooms we booked for an extra night and werfe told that it was ok and all booked for me. When we turned up they'd cancelled the Friday night for me, no booked the extra night for my business partner. I then spent the next 20 minutes trying to explain to the scarecrow from the Wizard of Oz (No Brain), what I wanted. Afetr about an hour I told them to cancel the booking and we'd find somewhere else as they obviously couldn't do something simple like book two rooms for that night. then they managed to get us the extra rooms. *Be Warned* there are no lifts in the hotel so if you're on the 3rd or 4th floor get ready to lug your luggage up the stairs. The rooms are hostel like, my partners was leaking water from the radiator and mine had clanking heating so not much sleep there. Not that we minded that much, who sleeps when they go to New York anyway!! Those of you who are going to NY shopping for gadgets here's a top tip - the camera / gadgets shops in Time Square have to pay a fortune for renting the shops there so, yes you guessed it they try and pass those costs onto their customers. If you're willing to walk a couple of blocks go to 370 West 51st Street (bet 8th & 9th Ave) and check out a little shop called E.P Electronics. You'll get all the gadgets you need at a fraction of the cost, and not have to go through the hassle of pushey salesmen who get very rude when you don't want to pay for something that you can cheaper over here in their shops. Getting back to the Sohotel, if you can afford a few quid more stay somewhere else there are plent of hotels in NY better than this toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem Near Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: italiana07
Reviews.Content: My mother and I really enjoy going to New York in December to experience the Christmas festivities. However, the hotel prices can sometimes turn you off. Not anymore!!!! I found this wonderful little hotel called Sohotel located in the SoHo neighborhood blocks from Little Italy and Chinatown. This is the most fabulous place to stay with a great price tag! We paid $218 a night, unheard of in New York at Christmas. This quaint hotel is on Broome St in a quiet, somewhat residential neighborhood. It is very clean and nicely decorated. Our room had 2 queen size beds that were very comfortable, very clean, updated bath, a small flatscreen television and service that was stellar!!!!!!! I cannot say enough about this hotel and it's staff. They were very courteous, helpful and attentive. It is a charming old building with no elevators but when we arrived a nice man came to carry our bags up the 1st flight of stairs that lead to the front desk where we checked in and was kind enough to carry them up the 2nd flight, which was greatly appreciated. Once settled in each night another nice gentleman knocked on our door to ask if we needed anything for our room (toothpaste, shampoo, bottled water, etc.) WHAT GREAT SERVICE! If you are planning a visit to the New York area I highly recommending this hotel. The prices are excellent, there are great restaurants just blocks away as well as shopping. Everything else is just a cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Staff Makes for a Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: cu_girl_ott
Reviews.Content: Staying at the SoHotel added to my great experience in New York. I truly believe that hotel staff make the difference between a good experience and a bad one. We were treated with respect and courtesy by the SoHotel's amazing and friendly staff. They met all our needs in a timely fashion and helped us feel at home. The hotel was clean and organized, which made it comfortable to relax there. We spent a lot of time with the staff, asking for directions and just chatting with them as we waited to head out. For that reason, I would like to mention specific staff members who really made our trip an enjoyable one. They are Julio, Jose, Jessi, and another wonderful lady whose name slipped my mind. If you want to pick a great hotel located in an accessible location with over-the-top staff, the SoHotel should be your first choice. Thanks to all the hotel staff for making the girls from Ottawa feel so welcomed!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: iwantjewelz
Reviews.Content: I am always fascinated by the different experiences people will have in the same hotel! The only thing that I can agree with from the negative reviews is that, yes, there is definitely thumpin' and bumpin' from the club below until 4am! We were in room 232 directly above the club, and even though our sleep might have been fitful, we managed to SOMEHOW live through it. My sleep would have been infinitely more disturbed by traipsing around in the middle of the night to demand a new room! And other than the music, our stay at the Sohotel was GREAT! Our room which was long and narrow, had high ceilings, wood floors and an exposed brick wall that added to the charm. Furnishings were at a minimum, due to the narrowness of the room, but it easily accomodated 4 women and a weekends worth of shopping and luggage. We had no problem with heat or water pressure. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, even going out to buy us a bag of ice, since they do not have an ice machine. Actually, that would be my biggest complaint about the hotel, but again, that surely didn't ruin our experience. There was a large flat screen TV in the room, and the small bathroom as well as our room were very clean. For walking around the neighborhood, we enjoyed wandering down Mulberry Street which is just a block away, right into the fun of Chinatown. Everything else in New York is just a subway or cab ride away! So if you are looking for a BUDGET hotel,around $200 a night in NYC, for a room that would actually sleep 5 people, with 2 doubles and a twin, I don't know how you could beat the Sohotel. You just need to go with the flow a bit, and have some fun! One word of warnng though. Get a signed quote on your parking ticket from the garage the hotel uses for parking. They jacked up our daily rate when we left, but we just wanted to get on the road. That was our only true negative.

Reviews.Title: “Room was okay, staff was very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: PenNhnd
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were booked for three nights. When we arrived on the first day we were a little dismayed to find such a flight of stairs from the sidewalk outside to the lobby, BUT a man came down immediately and not only took our luggage to the lobby but all the way up (and I do mean ALL the way UP) to the 4th floor where our room was. The room was TINY. And I do mean TINY. But I didn't come to NYC to sit in a hotel room so no complaints. We had a double bed, two end tables, a chest of drawers (with TV on top), and a chair all within about an 8x9 room. LOL But the bathroom was pretty and the furniture matched and was pretty nice. The room was also hot. At some point I broke down and turned on the air conditioner which wasn't the best in the world but not the worst either. Our shower was great! Perfect water pressure, perfect temp. We had plenty of towels. I will have to say that the smell of cigarette smoke was JUST AWFUL. I'm not sure where it was coming from but on the third morning I woke to the smell of freshly brewed coffee from the lobby so the smells must just travel in the hotel. The staff was VERY nice. Every time I passed one of them in the hall or up and down the stairs, they said good morning, good afternoon, good evening. When we arrived and I told the desk gal where we wanted to eat for dinner, she Mapquested it for us. The next morning she told us exactly where to go to get to the subway and then uptown. On our last morning we asked for a good diner for breakfast and coffee and the desk guy told us of a great place not two blocks away. Our room was 424, so if you are staying there and don't mind a SMALL room but one that is pleasant enough, ask for 424. :) Sure we heard people walking up and down the hall in the middle of the night who were talking but that is not the hotel's fault. That is rudeness on the part of the fellow travelers. But we heard no music from a club. Then again, I was so tired from hopping all over Manhattan for two days, I pretty much was passed out from fatigue anyway! :) All in all, a pleasant stay. Especially being so close to Little Italy and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay her if you'd like to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: grillmastaj1
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a (relatively) reasonably priced hotel for Christmas in NYC and thought we had found one. Not worth the money saved! The first night our room (rm 300) was literally right beside the stairs. I couldn't sleep because people were going up and down the stairs all night. It was loud. The next morning, I tried to take a shower- no water pressure. The water literally trickled down the wall. There were 2 temperatures, scalding or freezing. The only way I could get the shampoo out of my hair was to have my boyfriend pour cups of water on my head from the sink in the bathroom. We asked to switch rooms and they did, even putting our luggage in the new room while we were gone. The new room (rm 228) had a better shower head and water pressure, but no face clothes or hand towels. I suspected there was a problem with this room when we were getting ready for bed at 11:30 and I could sing, word for word along with a thumping Amy Winehouse. I thought, it's Sat. night in NYC, let it go. At 2:30 a.m. music is thumping, "Baby I got your number." The music had been thumping since 11:30 pm, straight. I went to front desk, again, and they said "Oh, that's the club." What???? They also said that it doesn't stop til 4 a.m. Seriously, 4 a.m. He offered to give us another room. We entered the third room, at 2:45 a.m. and were overwhelmed by the stench of smoke. The room STUNK! At that point, we had less than 5 hours to sleep and tried to sleep. It smelled so bad that I had to get the pillows from the other room though. Also, there was no alarm in this room, but face wash clothes. We thought the place was clean. Then we came home and both my boyfriend and I are all bitten up from something. Bedbugs? I don't know, but we were fine before we stayed here. There are no elevators and no phones in the rooms. Rooms are small. The furniture looks like it came from a yard sale. Close to Little Italy, which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: assignment
Reviews.Content: AWFUL!!!! You know when you go to a place and one thing right after the other starts happening? And at first youâ€™re not upset..but then things KEEP happening. A group of us were there for three nights. We each paid for a night with a different credit card. First, we walked into our room (2 double beds and 1 twin) to discover the beds had no blankets on them. Fine. We will let them do their thing and we will just grab a bite to eat and come back. Came back, the room had bee heavily sprayed with some scent and we noticed a roach had been smooshed on the ceiling above one of the beds. Gross! Next morning we discovered that the shower ran intervals where it was extremely cold and extremely hot. Not the most pleasurable experience. We also woke to discover that one girl had been bitten by what we thought were fleas (bc we could see them) all over her neck and torso! We discussed this with the front desk and they immediately changed us to two rooms with a single double bed and gave a refund for that night stay. Next morning, in room #1 they woke up to a freezing cold room and no way to turn on the heater. They then went to take a shower and NEVER got hot warm water. They times it for 20 minutes! Room 2, couldnâ€™t figure out how to turn on the heat. Shower took about 5 minutes to heat up (not the problem) and then the water pressure became less and less until there was absolutely NO water coming out of the showerhead! Not only was it freezing in the room but now I was wet with conditioner to rinse out of my hair! Come to find out minutes later, the girl who got bit had an allergic reaction and had to pay to rebook her flight so that she could go home to go to the doctor. (So, room 1 girls check out and now we are down to one single room) We are then refunded for the second night because of the problems. We have ONE more night to stay and have received a refund for the first two nights. The last girl and I return to our later that day to discover that the heat is mysteriously turned on in our room...the freezer had just became an unbearable sauna and we still couldnâ€™t figure out how to adjust the heat. So, of course, we go to the front deck to ask for some help. They are all already so pissed at us they all give us attitude and exclaim that there is a knob on the heater. And we say that they need to send someone up to then show us where it is because we donâ€™t see it! Maintenance guy comes up and says, " Oh! Hereâ€™s the problem! You have no knob." Duuh! Thatâ€™s what we had been telling the front desk! So he goes in another room, brings the knob in and turns off the heat. Then he goes to the front desk to tell them about the knob, comes back up, and tells us that we cant keep the knob because someone else is going to be checking into the other room and then if we want the heat back on we have to go back to the front desk and ask them to turn it on. Lets think about this for a minute...they want us to go down in the middle of the night when we are cold, half asleep, and in our pajamas so that we can wait until their ready to turn on our heat!?!?!? Wouldnâ€™t it have been easier to just reassign the other people to another room! Of course, we couldnâ€™t speak to a manager about this until morning. So we told him what happened and then preceded to tell him that we wanted the difference back from the price of the big room that we had paid for already and the smaller room we had been transferred to because of the fleas. Well, the manager blew up at me! Yelling that we are taking advantage of the situation, he was not going to give us a refund, and that he is the victim here! BS!! FIRST off, we were not asking for a refund, we wanted the difference in price from the bigger to the smaller room and SECOND our friend was the victim here by getting bit by fleas in his hotel! Its certainly not our fault his hotel and staff can keep things in running, CLEAN order!

Reviews.Title: “So friendly, great stay”
Reviews.Author: imawearytravler
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for the marathon and stayed at the Sohotel. I almost didn't stay there because of a review that said they were unfriendly but we did anyway. Thank goodness! We had nothing but friendly service. The doorman greeted me and after I checked in he carried my luggage up to the 4th floor. We stayed in room 451. It was small but clean and very cute. We forgot a hairdryer, they gave us one for the weekend to use. We didn't know our way around the city, they gave us maps and great directions. They don''t have a concierge but did call cabs for us and offered to call anywhere we needed to check on reservations. The only drawbacks (and the reason I only gave it 4 stars) was that there was no phones, radios or clocks in the room. They did however have a high definition flat screen tv. Also the heat was a radiator and we don't have those where I'm from. I had no idea that it was a wet heat and several things we had next to it, got soaked. This is a great hotel to stay at if you want chinatown and little Italy attractions. Expect to pay $15-$25 cab fare to get you up town (depending on time of day). It is about $60 cab to JFK. If you are in NYC to shop, there is a Bloomingdales within 8 blocks and a lot of really great retail shops close also. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, basic hotel (2 star)”
Reviews.Author: avihub
Reviews.Content: It was a Columbus Day long weekend, so there was not much of a choice. We stayed at the Sohotel, which is actually located in Chinatown and not at Soho. Nevertheless, the location is good and only 2 minutes to the nearest subway. We got a HUGE room (2 queen beds) which was lately been renovated , so everything was brand new and clean. It was on the first floor and the room was very quiet. There is a free coffee in the morning near the reception (however there is no real lobby)

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ran49
Reviews.Content: great location very clean good staff free storage free coffe in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Feldie
Reviews.Content: Is this hotel actually in the hospitality business? Our impression from our arrival until our early departure after we had found another hotel, was of an attitude of unfriendliness and "couldn't care less". The entrance of this hotel opens onto an upward flight of stairs: We arrived with 2 heavy suitcases and several bags. There was somebody from the hotel staff outside the entrance , busy talking on his cell phone. After we had struggled up the staircase with the heavy suitcases, he reluctantly brought up 2 small ones, and asked me if I couldn't carry more. Some reception! Then we came to the room â€“ we had requested a quiet room which we were assured that it was. Apart from the fact that the window was stuck and needed a Herculean effort to open it, it opened onto several air conditioning outlets from adjacent buildings, and below our â€˜quietâ€™ room was one of Sohoâ€™s hottest nightclubs with the â€œdoof-doofâ€� thump of the amplified music vibrating through the bed from 10pm to 4am. If the bed had been comfortable, we may just have dropped off to sleep after 4am, but the mattress was rubber hospital style, with a waterproof covering, complete with wrinkles. As if this wasnâ€™t enough, there was no telephone, save a payphone in the lobby, no elevator for 5 floors, bare floor, and bare brick walls in the room, completing the dismal effect of a cell. There was one redeeming feature: we were provided with two half-pint bottles of spring water each day. Accommodation in NYC is scarce and expensive, but for the same price as we were paying at Sohotel, we were able to find a hotel in the same area with a decent mattress, no nightclub below, an elevator, and with professional and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: robbo1963
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights - the hotel is ideally located, we walked everywhere and was easy to find.The room itself was very small - we were on the 3rd floor - very clean though small.... very noisy with people walking down the corridor- alot of noise comes thru the door so we were woken with late revellers returning to the hotel. The bed we had was not the best either.... aleways squeeked when you rolled over and the mattress was covered with a plastic cover which also made a noise... so least to say we did not get alot of sleep. Though for the price paid it was okay...If you are looking for 4 star Plus don't stay here this is no where near any of that, clean reasonably comfortable, good location - thats about it.....

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BnCh6
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in NYC. The area immediately surrounding the hotel itself is not the best, it borders China Town but you are within walking distance of Little Italy, Soho and Grenwich Village. Four of us went and we had a room on the Hotel's first floor which is actually the Second Floor. The room was large with three beds, a Large Flat screen, 15' ceilings with a fan, Natural brick wall and hardwood floors. The room was clean however it was a little noisy, Broome and Bowery is a busy intersection. Front desk was freindly. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but a solid choice”
Reviews.Author: Sharita
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a no-frills, but totally-worth-the-price type of hotel, the Sohotel might be for you. What it lacks in street presence, and the fact that there is a long stairway or two to traverse, it more than makes up for with a great location, a perfectly fine room, easy access to subways, and employees that give far more than most. My 17 year old daughter and I (a female) stayed at the Sohotel for two nights and we were not disappointed. Our room was more than adequate; exactly what I had expected based on comments I'd read online that seemed measured and fair. We felt completely safe, were two blocks from charming Little Italy, and we found the staff very helpful. They will even hold your luggage for you after check out so that you can maximize your time in the city. Make sure you ask where to park your car if you have one, as they have an arrangement with one of the garages nearby. I was unaware of this fact, and when one of the hotel employees heard the outrageous amount of money I was being charged for my car ($50/night!), he insisted on walking to the garage with us, carrying my luggage the 2-3 blocks I must add, to make sure that it was understood that we were staying at the hotel and entitled to the reduced price. This fine young man, walked back to the hotel to stamp my parking stub with the hotel stamp, and stayed with me until he felt certain that all had been worked out. As a huge, and unfortunate, word of caution...the second that he left, the parking attendent tried to charge me the original price suspecting, I suppose, that I was caught between a rock and a hard place seeing as he was holding my car hostage. Make sure that you have the stomach to stick to your guns, or don't come with a car...I had more than one difficulty with parking people... But again, I was so terribly grateful to that young man who did something for me that he certainly did not have to do and what most people surely would not have done. We would stay at this hotel again and we would recommend it to our friends. It's a perfectly fine, clean, no frills choice.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ehrenfeld
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from san francisco we stayed there also in a budget hotel we had the fear that the sohotel will be the same adventure.but we where quiet surprise, the sohotel was very clean.one of the best location in mahattan,the staff was very helpfull, the rooms are small but clean and well maintained, we saw much bigger rooms but it is another $40 extra a night , se we decided to stay in the smaller room and we realy had an enjoyable stay,i must say that was worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: SohotelReview
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from the Sohotel and found it was a good place to stay even if this is an average hotel. We knew that we would be outside almost all the time, so we mostly wanted a clean place to stay. The bed sheet, the washroom and the room were very clean. Tiny and clean. I was concern with some previous comments about bedbugs, and fortunatly we didn't have any. The bed was confortable enough, not the best but not bad either. The service was ok but not bad. What would you expect at this price, the Waldorf-Astoria? Yes, $180 a night is expensive but for NYC this is a good price. Would we go back? Yes. Would we recommend it? Yes, only to the people who don't expect too much of an hotel of this price.

Reviews.Title: “Worth your money and Great location...!”
Reviews.Author: 07ciaobelli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are occasional travelers, but we certainly appreciate clean accomodations and friendly attendance any time ! Stayed at the Sohotel for 10 days and never felt more comfortable and welcome. We decided to write this, not only to thank the staff but also to reccomend the place ! The unique blend of the past architectural features and the modern renovations, gives to you a different sensation among other hotels choices; anywhere in Manhattan ! Once we get home, we'll share the experience with our friends in Italy and thank them again for sending us there....! Ciao, ...until December....

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: seh005
Reviews.Content: Sohotel is not a hotel. It is about equal to tenement housing dating back to the early 1900's. My whole body is covered in bedbug bites. I actually SAW the bugs in the bed numerous times. If you have children, allergies, or other health problems, DO NOT stay here. Actually do not stay here at all, save yourself from having to go to the doctor and having to dealing very rude, aggressive, and careless staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantaqstic, rustic little place. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: 6-fooot_midget
Reviews.Content: The SoHotel is a no-frills, get-what-you-pay-for joint at the corner of Broome & Bowery, about 5 or 6 blocks (ish) from the former CBGB site. It's a 40floor walkup in the Lighting district, and is itself above an old lighting store. It is not much to look at, and offers even less in the service department. It is, however, awesome. Although it is not advertised as such, the SoHotel is the oldest hotel in New York City. It's in a part of SoHo that allows for a 5 min walk to old Little Italy, Chinatown, and the aforementioned CBGB site or Joey Ramone place. Broome is not that far south of Houston, and therefore offers a short walk to a NYC Must-see, Katz's Deli (where Harry met Sally, for those of you interested in such things.) The entire neighbourhood around SoHotel is bustling with little shops, diners, patessieries, nightspots, and upscale restaurants (especially Little Italy, which is literally 2 blocks West of the hotel). Subway stations are short walks in any direction...you can get on the brown or the green very easily. The hotel itself is, as I said, not much to look at, but the historical aspect makes it all worth it. It is not only very clean (not a single bug was seen during our 4-days stay), but recent renovations have given it a very old-New-York style. All the inside rooms (vs. the outside rooms, which have windows) have an exposed brick wall that is part of the original building and sports a skylight, to make up for the lack of windows. The dividing walls are paper-thin and the rooms themselves are about 250 sq. feet (if that), but unlike other hostel-style hotels, this one has a private bathroom in every room and full maid service daily. The rooms are nicely appointed with a full bureau and closet, and the beds are comfortable. There is a TV in evcery room, many of them fat-panel LCDs. Finally, I have to mention the front desk service. New York is a city in which service institutions live and die on word-of-mouth, and the SoHotel is obviously wll aware of this and takes every step to ensure your stay is a comfortable one. When we arrived (the 4 of us) with the intention of staying in on e room with 2 double beds, the discovered that they had made a mistake and given us a single. Rather than move us into another room, the Concierge was kind enough to provide us with a SECOND room, completely of his own accord. I can't recommend the SoHotel highly enough; the location, the history, the price and the service all made it a very comfortable place to stay and added to our overall enjoyment of our NYC visit. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “SoHotel, SoHovel”
Reviews.Author: westcoastadventurer
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this place is the location... That's it. Put is this way, the first thing I did when I got into the room was check the fire escape map on the back of the door because I was sure the place was going to burn down or something else horrible was going to happen. From there, I decided to shower. There was both scalding hot water and freezing cold water...nothing in between. Two days of cold showers--that was fun. The bed was lumpy and of questionable cleanliness. I've read other reviews of bed-bugs--luckily I'm not itchy...yet. The air conditioner was so dusty that it looked like it may have been picked up off the street and stuck in the window. One night we came back and there was a guy sleeping in the lobby like it was Penn Station. There was not even an attempt to check if people who were wandering around the place were staying there--and I'm not sure they were. If you have ever been to a small, European hotel--this is a bad and charmless version of one of these hotels. It is better to stay in New Jersey...that's how bad this place was...

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: MissInternet
Reviews.Content: I went to NY with a friend and we wanted something downtown, but not expensive. The Sohotel fit the bill perfectly. We didn't have any bedbugs in our room. I read reviews that said the place is noisy and it is. Lots of street noise, which has pretty much been the case in every NY hotel I've stayed at. I came prepared with earplugs, so I was able to sleep very well. Our room was clean, the bedding was fresh, no stains. The shower temperature was hard to control, but that wasn't too much of a problem. Our TV had cable and good reception. They have really good coffee in the lobby in the morning, which I didn't discover until our 2nd day there. I think that the Sohotel is a good value for the money. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: wmegowan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not a nice place to stay and here is why: 1. The staff is not helpful. The day before we were to leave I asked if they had an alarm I could borrow-since there are no phones in the room a wake up call was not an option. They said 'no', they didn't have one. But, they could give a wake-up knock on the door. I scheduled one for 5:00am. Luckily I woke up on my own at 4:45 (not difficult as the constant sirens and traffic that you hear throughout the night make it difficult to sleep in the first place) because they never came to for the wake-up knock. When I went downstairs to check out no one was there. The phone was ringing, I called out 'hello' but no answer. I waited 15 minutes in the lobby before a man came out from a room behind the front desk rubbing sleep from his eyes. When I asked him about the wake up knock he said, 'I don't see no wake up knock here'. So, then I said to him, we also scheduled a ride to the airport yesterday for 5:30 am to the airport (something they offer for $45. Oh, he didn't have that written down either. Luckily there was another sleeping man that woke up and came out so he was able to drive us for the $45. 2. The place is dingy. The walls are dirty and EVERYTHING squeeks, I guess they've never heard of WD40. The blinds are dirty and broken. 3. The bed is one of the most uncomfortable beds I've ever slept on. And, it is a full, not even a queen. It has a plastic sheet underneath the the sheet-I guess they are worried about guests wetting the bed??? You can feel the springs. 4. It is very noisy. 5. The room is TINY. Barely enough room to walk around. Sink is in bedroom since there is no room in the bathroom for it. The bathroom is so small that you can touch elbow to elbow in the shower, and when you get out of the shower you practically step in the toilet. 6. The water temperature in the shower was the worst, it did not stay consistent for more than 5-10 seconds-then it went from scorching hot to freezing cold. I do not recommend staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: vens910
Reviews.Content: 1. The room was really tiny with hardly enough room to walk around the bed. 2. The bed was definitely one of the least comfortable mattresses I've ever slept on. 3. Terrible tv reception so could hardly even watch the news in the morning. 4. They are undergoing construction so be prepared for noise during the day. 5. There is no elevator so be prepared to climb stairs -- 1 flight to reception and then 1-3/4 to your room. 7. Very limited amenities -- I asked for an iron but they didn't have any at the desk so I'm glad I decided to steam my clothes in the shower because I never received one. 8. Management has no sense of customer service. I had a layover and Detroit and after waiting 4 hours (due to delays) for my connection to New York, I found out the airport was shut down and all flights were canceled. I had to stay in Detroit so I called the Sohotel and they said that would be fine. When I paid for the hotel they charged me for one night since I arrived on the 11th and left on the 12th. I checked my credit card statement and they charged me twice. When I called, they said it's because of their cancellation policy and that was that. I think that since this was out of my control, management should have some type of loyalty or sense of service to their customer and not be so unforgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, bed bugs! and construction!”
Reviews.Author: intransitsf
Reviews.Content: The price was right, the hotel staff were nice, and the place was clean. But the first room we stayed in (#310) had bed bugs. The manager was good about it and gave us another room. The second room (#405) seemed to be free of bugs, but loud construction started around 8am every morning (including Saturday) 2 doors down, and it lasted until after 6pm. Since we like to go out at night when we're in NY, we ended up getting little sleep. If not for the bed bugs, it would deserve an average rating, but now we're worried we brought the bugs home. We'll probably call a professional, so we didn't really save any money staying at Sohotel. My vote? Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: pascaplume
Reviews.Content: Could have been lovely, close to perfect....The room was cheap and look clean... But there was Bed bugs....If your are allergic to any bugs bite don't go there. I'm still recovering and I hope I didn't bring them back home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sohotel”
Reviews.Author: CanuckD
Reviews.Content: Though the double bed room was pretty small, and the hotel was short on 'extras', who needs them when you're in NYC? The room we had was clean and appeared 'new' (it seemed that the hotel was undergoing renovations at the time). With one exposed brick wall, and recently done hardwood floors, I was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and A+ location!”
Reviews.Author: time_traveler99
Reviews.Content: I wasn't too sure about this hotel given some of the reviews. No bedbugs, no cockroaches. Yes you do have to walk up stairs but not a big deal. The room was extremely clean and much more than I expected for being a budget hotel. This hotel is within walking distance to Little Italy and Chinatown. Safe neighborhood. I have two minor complaints. The directions given from Newark Airport were inaccurate including fares listed. I had to pay more to get there and got lost following website directions. The other complaint was the room I reserved was not the room I got. When I asked to change they said they were all booked up and offered no apology or alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Betty78
Reviews.Content: One of the few hotels in NY without any cockroaches which was very surprising since NY is a cockroach infected city :) Very clean and inexpensive, has rooms for up to 5 people to stay. Very friendly staff, I was there for a week with 4 girlfriends and felt very safe and appriciated the cleanliness! Rooms are very nice also, the location is great, close to subway and it is in little Italy walking distance to chinatown where you have to go to shopping when you are in NY. If you wanna leave the windows open at night it might get a little loud since it is a busy neighborhood but we had a great working AC in the room so we didn't have to open it :) Would recommend to anybody, I am happy to finally have found a great hotel in NY for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessAmanda
Reviews.Content: I must admit, following the comments of some people on this website, we were panicking big time! But on arrival, despite the first room being too small for an 8 day stay, they moved us to a larger room with no problems at all and it was a great room, exposed brick walls, large window, air con and ceiling fan, huge marble bathroom with large marble shower cubicle, tv, wardrobe, two bedside cabinets and a large chest of drawers, they even lent me a hairdryer for the duration of our stay.. The room was cleaned every day, with fresh bedding and towel, EVERY DAY! When you walked in the door at the front of the hotel, you could smell the freshly cleaned aroma of disinfectant. The staff were lovely, polite and helpful. Free tea and coffee in reception each day. For the money, it is well worth it. Room 315 if anyone wants to ask for it. Ignore the comments others have made about cockroaches etc - it was spotless throughout. The location is to die for - within walking distance of 5 - 10 mins, you have little italy, SoHo and SoHo's Bloomingdales (yeah, what a nice surpise), Tribeca, Chinatown etc etc. L'orange Bleu was a great restraunt too - a brill stay! Well don to SoHotel and I will be recommending you to all my friends and collegues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: stupotsEngland
Reviews.Content: Good Points: We are on a tight budget and wanted to stay in Manhattan, but all the hostels were booked up, so next on our list was the Sohotel. For the money, it is brilliant. The rooms are small, but are clean and more than cormfortable. The location is superb. Walking distance to Ground Zero, Statue Liberty etc..., and great for Italian food, with Mulberry Street just around the corner. Subway to Uptown is only a block or two away, so it was perfect. Bad Points: We were woken up on our first morning by a wall being knocked down. There appears to be some building work going on at the moment. We complained, and when we returned from our day out, they had moved all our stuff to a much nicer room, so that was ok. the aircon can be a bit noisy, and the walls are a little thin, but these are minor quibbles for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for New York stay”
Reviews.Author: fwic
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to New York where we stayed at the Sohotel. We were booked in there by our airline and were amazed at how helpful and friendly the staff were. The rooms were clean and neat and contained all that we needed for a stay in New York. Although perhaps smaller than many out of town rooms, compared to what we have experienced on previous trips to NYC it was more than adequate and it certainly met our needs. The location is excellent and it is not far to the subway which is by far the best way to travel in this big city. There are lots of restuarants and shops nearby and we were amazed at the friendliness (and honesty) of the local people from this area. We appreciated it so much that when we went back to NYC before returning home we again chose to stay here because of the reasonable (for New York) rates. I can recommend this place to travellers who want a safe, friendly and helpful base in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the money”
Reviews.Author: delbertal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sohotel two nights, from May 6-8. It was not luxurious, but it was very, very clean. The staff were very nice and easy to deal with, especially Gene, who was fabulous. There are no "extras", for example, a clock, a telephone, but there is a TV and everything in the place - beds, sink, faucets, was strong and of great quality. You have to remember that Manhattan is very expensive and this hotel was quite reasonable for the area. You are a few blocks from Chinatown, which is a totally great experience with wonderful, really cheap restaurants and a short subway or cab ride from many other wonderful places - mostly more expensive. We would definitely stay there again. Dalya and Mike

Reviews.Title: “We would stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmflores
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised!!! Based on previously entered comments, we were not sure what to expect. However, the Sohotel was extremely clean, very comfortable, & the staff were courteous & helpful! The rooms are small but that is typical when traveling in NY city on a budget. We were close to the subway & public bus stop so traveling throughout the city was easy. We were able to walk to the WTC site, financial district, & the ferry to go to the Statue of Liberty. The Sohotel is located in the intersection of Little Italy, China Town, & Soho so there were plenty of great places to eat at reasonable prices. The Sohotel is also located near Canal Street which is a great place to shop. And yes, as others have commented, you can hear people in the hallways of the hotel - but duh!!! The Sohotel has hardware floors throughout, so that is normal. Just use earplugs! The noise never bothered us! However, I would suggest (to the Sohotel) that they consider upgrading to newer mattresses. Ours was older & felt it could be replaced. But nonetheless, we still slept fine! We would definitely stay there again - the staff was very helpful, we were comfortable, the Sohotel was clean, & we look forward to another visit!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't like adventure be careful”
Reviews.Author: gosabresgo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a birthday trip to New York. The hotel seems to be clean and has charm. When I checked in, I was told I could not have the room I reserved because the maid had left early and it wasn't clean. Then I heard I ain't cleaning it from the other desk clerk. They did offer me a room at a discounted rate. The discount was because the room did not have a window. The room was small, you had to step up 12 inches into the bathroom, and the 13 inch TV had rabbit ears. I had no problem with street noise because we didn't have a window. There was a lot of hall noise. The room was clean and the mattress offered a plastic cover under the sheet. I thought this was a nice touch given that it's a cheap hotel. The walk to Little Italy and SOHO shopping isn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “just can't stay away!!! loving this place!!!!!!g”
Reviews.Author: geeedup
Reviews.Content: i had some hell of a time at the sohotel,the room i had was big.it had 3 beds and the staff was alot of help with our bags! i didn't think i would ever find a room like this without giving my arm or leg, but the price was real good and we had fun at the car show!!!!! thank you sohotel.....: }

Reviews.Title: “the worst”
Reviews.Author: Europeans
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in the US and the sohotel was the worst experience we had. The bed was very small on the first room, where we found hairs (we strongly suspct they don't change them every time a new guest comes in). If you look for sleeping at night don't go there!! it's very noisy, depending on rooms. At the 3re sleeples night we asked for a quieter room and we got a room without window, for the same 'cheap' price of 188 dollars. We still wonder if it's legal to rent rooms without windows. The front desk staff wasn't very helpful either. I think you can find better places for the same rates.

Reviews.Title: “Flop House”
Reviews.Author: kipukatrading
Reviews.Content: I grew up in the neighborhood where Sohotel now sits. It was an old transient hotel on skid row called the Pioneer Hotel. Now the Bowery is a trendy area. However, their efforts to dress up this former flop house into a two hundred dollar a night property fall far short. The staff is indifferent and unfriendly. They had no record of my reservation that I made through Hotwire and I was forced to stand in the lobby upon check in for about an hour trying to log on to their non existent wireless system, which never happened. The front desk clerk was kind enough to give me a room, only to go through this mess in the morning. Basically, these are the same small, dark rooms they always were,only now instead of winos, Europeans make their way up the endless stairs. The two positive points are that the property is clean and the location is very good it you prefer to stay downtown. It is in a good location with proximity to Chinatown, Tribeca, Little Italy, the court buildings and lower Manhattan. There were absolutely no amenities: no clock, no phone, no view. If you can, pay a little more and avoid the inconvenience of this hotel. You can dress a flop house up, but you can't take them anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “tiny but cheap”
Reviews.Author: jojofantastico
Reviews.Content: I am so-so about the sohotel. the location was absolutely great and that alone would justify the price. the hotel itself felt a little like a dorm - the rooms are incredibly small and the bathroom door didn't shut. but it was cheap and a great location and i would stay there again if i was going to new york. don't expect miracles but don't pay too much and you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice but really noicy”
Reviews.Author: kpunkt
Reviews.Content: The Sohotel is a very clean Hotel, the rooms are nice, but small. Staff is OK and the location of the Hotel is very good. The only really bad thing is the noice, there is a bar below the Hotel and this is really extremly loud until about 3 a.m. But it is a cheap Hotel, and you can spend more money on shopping or sightseeing. I can reccommend it to budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been alot worse!”
Reviews.Author: motti80s
Reviews.Content: After booking and then coming across a mix of comments on the site about the Sohotel I was quite anxious to discover that I might have made a mistake in booking out of haste. But I'm relieved to say that once I got there I was pleasantly surprised at the adequacy of the room and the hotel generally. The room was clean and comfortable, even if a little on the small side. But the location (right in the midst of the mayhem that is Manhattan!) made up for this. My major qualm was with the hot water in the shower, It took a long time to heat up, but I found funnily enough that a few turns of the toilet flush speeded the process up abit (don't ask how, funny plumbing i guess!). All in all you pretty much get what you pay for and the hotel staff were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: efiezra
Reviews.Content: me and my friend stayed for 4 nights in the sohotel. the hotel was very clean , we had a housekeeper service daily fresh towels,leenens, on daily basis, the staff is very helpfull. despite the old building,we had a great stay the best part ,was the location and the rate, we shall recomend this hotel to all our friends

Reviews.Title: “Worst part of my trip”
Reviews.Author: EEREE
Reviews.Content: I've been to nyc a couple of times, and staying at sohotel has made me NEVER want to return to nyc. My room was crawling with cockroaches, spiders, and centipedes in the drawers. I told the front desk, and she said in a thick spanish accent, "roaches are everywhere, so dont be complaining" My husband also suffers from orthopedic problems, so I had to constantly escort him up the stairs, there are NO elevators for a 6-FLOOR motel. the bathrooms are tiny and the hot water can get VERY hot; make sure you let the water on for at least 40 minutes to test if it won't burn your skin. Also, at night, there were strangers knocking on my door and beer bottles left on my door. There's no security, so if you are traveling with children, be very careful. P.S. they charge u $15 luggage fee per day, so don't travel heavily

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: erika_kos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and had very mixed feelings. On the positive side, it is *very* clean. Spotless. The rooms are well-appointed - nice furniture. Small, but this is New York. On the cons side, we did find it a bit noisy, and our shower never really worked quite right. No water came out on Day 1, and on Day 2 we could only get hot water by wiggling the handle to the *exact* right spot. We complained, but management did nothing. My husband ended up showering in the shared shower down the hall, which worked out fine for him. Also, be warned - it's a walk-up. No elevator, and the stairs are steep. No fax machine either, in case you were wondering. However, we did get free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST value you'll find!”
Reviews.Author: Juttie
Reviews.Content: For the price being about 1/3 of any other decent hotel in Manhatten, I was a little worried, and needless to say, my expectations were not high. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel. It was very cute and clean once inside and it's in a great part of town - not too touristy. Our room was tiny, but clean and the staff was friendly, although obviously not from a 5 star hotel. It you want to go to NYC and enjoy the city, the Sohotel is the place for you. It's safe and clean and it'll leave you with money in your pocket to spend elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and PACK YOUR EAR PLUGS”
Reviews.Author: Tennis05
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews regarding this hotel we are, in a way reassured, that we were not over critical during our stay, because our experiences definitely detracted from our otherwise great time in New York. Clearly, the USA do not have the same customer protection laws as the UK. On arrival you have to lug your luggage up steep stairs into the reception area. The hotel covers 4 floors with no lifts. No assistance is offered by staff to take your luggage to the upper floors. The website gives the impression of moderm rooms with ample space. In some places you had to walk sideways around the room. Our bathroom was designed more for `hobbits' not human beings. Although most staff were very helpful we had to describe to 3 different people that we had an extra night booked. This had been agreed before we left the UK.. Its stressful being told 3 times you have no room booked for your last night. If you want a quiet hotel DO NOT stay here. There is no double glazing in the rooms and hence road traffic is very audible, even at the back of the hotel on floors 2 and 3 (we tried several during our stay). At least the traffic noise drowned out the heating pipes playing an irritating tune all night long. We had to listen to the Guy's TV in the next room blaring at full volume til 5.30 am. He checked out and we thought yes some sleep. We returned the next night hopeful of a few hours sleep to find on Thurs-Sat our room was directly above a bar/club. The floor actually vibrated to the thud thud of the music until at least 3-4am, and no soundproofing seemed to be in place. What is even more annoying is the Staff were fully aware this was common practice but failed to draw it to our attention. Asking $180 dollars a night is a disgrace for such a room. Our best purchase in New York, was not at Macys but the local drug store - Ear Plugs - but these were only partially successful. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone, who requires more than 3 hours sleep a night.

Reviews.Title: “great deal!!”
Reviews.Author: chicfromcanada
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent i was presently surprised that this hotel was soo cheap!! Pros: great price, awsome location, and friendly staff. rooms where small but nice and very clean Cons: No elevator, apperance somewhat weary but once you've been it grows on you It is a 5$ cab ride to time square and you are in a great locations right in the middle of chinatown, little italy and soho. Honestly this one rocks for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Read This! You don't want to take the risk...”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis121
Reviews.Content: Before we headed to New York we saw the bad reviews about the Sohotel, but we took the chance. We arrived at the hotel at about 12am where we had to carry our heavy luggage up numerous flights of stairs as there is no lift. The desk attendants were no help even though they were large men where we were young women who had to find the strength to lug our bags up the several flights of stairs. At night Soho is very dodgy where it is unsafe to be out and about. The next day when we asked for directions and information about tourist activities the desk attendants were not helpful and gave us wrong information. The rooms are very small that only one of us could have been at one side of the bed at the one time. The bathroom is tiny tiny tiny. The toilet blocked. That day we saw numerous people signing out of the hotel as they were given a room without a bathroom. There is a nightclub underneath the hotel where it is extremely loud until early morning. I've never complained i don't think ever about a hotel. I usually don't set too high standards but i feel it was important for me to warn people away from this hotel. Though you may think it you may be able to risk staying there as it is cheaper than alot of other New York City accommodation. If you spend more money on accommodation, your trip will definitely be more enjoyable. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sightseeing1888
Reviews.Content: We were a bit scared after reading the reviews, but we must have landed lucky. We were on the 4th floor, and although it was a struggle with the cases, well worth it when we saw the room. It was a huge room with 2 queen beds, large bathroom and a huge plasma TV, we were impressed. No problems incurred throughout our stay, although the noisy pipes kept on going all through the night, but hey your in New York, your too tired from all the sight-seeing to stay awake and hear them anyway. Great little bar below the hotel, but ask how much before you pay for the drinks. I would recomend this hotel, it was right round the corner from everywhere you would need.

Reviews.Title: “SoHotel - Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: 28_year_old_female
Reviews.Content: I don't usually spend time putting reviews of hotels on websites, but this place deserves it - it's the worst place I've ever stayed. The first night we had room 430. To start with, the rooms on the 4th floor are shabby and seriously tiny - in any other hotel, they'd be single person rooms. The bathrooms are so small that the sinks are in the bedroom space. We tried to make the best of it, but eventually we had to move room as neither of us could sleep - the pipes in the bathroom bang so loud all night it was like someone was hammering on the wall. 2nd and 3rd night we were on the 3rd floor, room 308 - the room was better, but we realised on the 3rd night it had mice. We saw one running around while we were in bed. And one got on my bed while we were out and attacked the sweets I had bought to give at home as gifts. The night staff didn't believe us and it was only when we showed the gnawed candy the next morning that we got our room changed - back to the 4th floor, and another night of noisy pipes and sleeping on top of each other. In addition, the staff made a mistake with our booking, and every time we needed to speak to anyone at reception, about anything, we had to first spend half an hour going through why our booking had been wrong, and who we'd told, when etc. It was a joke. I'm a 28 yr old female, travelling with a female friend, we've both spent time travelling as backpackers and been to New York before, so know what to expect from a cheap hotel. This is not worth it - pay a little extra and stay somewhere decent.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for backpackers, but don't leave food lying around!”
Reviews.Author: InkwotaBeru
Reviews.Content: We were first booked into the tiny double room with a sink stuck on the wall mentioned by an earlier reviewer. The room was clean, so we decided to give it a go. Then, at 2am, we awoke to hear rustling noises under the bed and realized our room was infested with rats!!! The hotel refunded the cost of our candy, which had been mauled in the night (!) and we switched to another room. This was a twin room and was about a third bigger than the previous one, with a much better bathroom. I recommend asking for a different room if you aren't happy with the initial one you get, as they will probably change it for you. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating, and the hotel as a whole appeared clean (despite the vermin). And the location is much better than being stuck around Times Square, which feels like a rather inauthentic tourist trap. I would recommend this hotel if you can't afford anything else and you're ready to travel in backpacker conditions. I wouldn't recommend it if you're a) looking for a romantic break or b) you're planning on spending more than an hour a day in your room.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: gl0betrotter
Reviews.Content: I canâ€™t believe that this hotel has the gull to charge the amount of money that it does! I know that NY, especially Manhattan is notorious for being an expensive city; however, I have stayed at several different hotels in various parts of the city in the same price range that were not only more comfortable but also were a whole lot cleaner and safer for the same amount of money. The only â€˜advantageâ€™, if you could call it that, is the location; however, as the public transportation in NY is so convenient, you really donâ€™t need to stay in any particular area/neighborhood in order to experience and enjoy the city. Sohotel is absolutely the worse hotel that Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. The location, although convenient in getting around the Chinatown/SOHO area, is extremely pricey and inconvenient to get to from the airports and Penn Station, as there are no direct connection via subway and taking a cab through the maze of that area is quite costly. Also, the hotel has no elevator; so, if you have a lot or heavy luggage, it will give you a hernia climbing the 4th floor walk up, where, unfortunately, our room was located, and once you make your way up to your room, you wonder why the hell youâ€™d made that climb, or the reservation for that matter, in the first place, as it made me want to walk right out and look for another hotel. Moreover, the hotel is so unsafe that a warning is written on the key holder that â€˜You should double lock/bolt your room.â€� As mentioned, in all of my travels to NYC, this was the worse hotel experience, and my stay at Sohotel has proven that my sense of adventure in trying to discover new quaint hotels has reached its limit. Thereâ€™s absolutely no reason to stay at a hotel like this unless you want a truly â€˜bohemianâ€™ experience, while paying close to $200/night, which is a pure nonsense.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ballulah
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Sohotel and would like to share our views. Firstly if you don`t or can`t do stairs avoid this hotel it has no lift, from the street you have to climb a staircase to get to reception with all your bags/ cases. We were on the 2nd floor (not the highest) so had a further 2 flights of stairs to climb to our room. We arrived at 14.15 and were not permitted into our room until 15.00 as stated, they did however let us leave our bags. We booked a D grade room and found it to be a fair size. It had a double bed and a single, the bathroom was small but adequate with a shower that eventually runs hot but keeps a constant temperature. The rooms were cleaned and towels changed every day, i can`t fault their cleanliness. The rooms were shoddy inside and we found it hard not to compare the quality to equivalent priced rooms we have stayed in but this is New York have you seen how much the other hotels charge. The staff were excellent very helpful whenever called upon and they speak excellent english. Coffee is provided every morning in reception for free. Overall i would give this hotel a 1 star mainly because of the lack of a lift and the shoddy condition of the room but for somewhere to rest your head after a hectic days shopping/ sight seeing it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: brian7745
Reviews.Content: It was my first time staying in a hotel in manhattan. I was very pleased ,i have heard some horror stories about other hotels and had many pre- conceived notions .My brother and I ( from rochester ,n.y.) were welcomed and treated very well. The rooms were cleaned every day with proper beddings and other service.Fresh coffee and muffins in the lounge.The hotel is small but it has a great "feel " to it.The neighborhood is quaint and friendly with little italy a stones throw away. I would suggest and have to anyone traveling to NYC to stay at the hotel.It is perfect for less than 4 people ( a little small) but warm inside. Prices are very affordable as well.

Reviews.Title: “My Room Wasn't Cleaned for 3 Days!”
Reviews.Author: Kswany
Reviews.Content: Before arriving at the Sohtoel, I was skeptical based on the low price and the excellent location. My fears became reality. I stayed at the Sohotel for business in late September. I checked in and they gave me my room on the fourth floor. No problem until they also gave somebody else my room later that evening. This person had a key but the front desk had not registered me into the room. Not only that but they also failed to find me in the register when I told them that my key would not work in the door - three seperate times! Each time they said that they had no record of me. The worst part was the towels. One of them had a blood or rust stain on it. I didn't get to close to tell the difference. It would have been nice had the cleaning staff taken the towel out of my room but my room was not cleaned for three days! - my entire stay. I informed the front desk that I wanted to talk to a manager whom they said would call me the next morning. I am still waiting for the phone call.... You had better like ABC because it was the only channel that reception would come in on the television. I had forgotten what rabbit ears looked like. On the positives, the location is superb. Just a couple of blocks down the road is Broadway with some of the best shopping in the city. Little Italy and Chinatown are an easy walk away and the subway line is only a short walk away. The location couldn't have better. The rooms in the back of the hotel are relatively quiet for downtown New York. Do yourself a favor and spend a little more for a better hotel. You deserve better service and this hotel cannot provide it.

Reviews.Title: “not a pleasent experience”
Reviews.Author: travelllerworld
Reviews.Content: Talking about incompetant staff. People work at the reception are not able to handle the easiest problems. No elevators. Therefore, be prepared to carry your own luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and economically feasible”
Reviews.Author: vmi
Reviews.Content: We had a mavelous time, the rooms were clean, bathrooms were in excellent condition and the people at the front desk very friendly, helpful and considerate. Elena, Milton and Julio helped four of us figure out how to use the subways, directions to local destinations from the Port Authority to Ground Zero. I was very impressed with staying in New York in a great location which was fun, near the Village, China Town, shopping on Canal Street and Little Italy. The rates were very reasonable for such a nice, clean small hotel. Thank you for listing this and we will not only go back whenever we are in New York but have already told my friends. By the way we were representing Boston, Paris and St. Barths, ages 64, 58, 24 and 40. We booked this reservation as my friend's niece had taken her two children to New York and found the Sohotel on the computer.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Sohotel”
Reviews.Author: EJCS
Reviews.Content: We booked Sohotel for a week-long stay without having done much research. I later came across tripadvisor and was dreading the trip because of negative reports of bedbugs etc. But there was no need. PROS: brilliant downtown location - v close to numerous subways including Canal St from where you can get the Q train to Macy's (34th St) in 3 stops. It's one of the more frequent lines too. 10-15 minute walk to Soho shopping and nightlife, China Town (great for dim sum) and even shorter to Little Italy. Loads of eateries in the vicinity and we were fortunate to be there for the San Genarro fesitval. Nice to be away from the throngs of tourists that you would suffer if you stayed eg around Times Sq. Area looks down at heel in the day but buzzes at night. Cleanliness - our room was spotless. I am particularly fussy about cleanliness and did a thorough inspection. NO BEDBUGS WHATSOEVER! nor were there mice or cockroaches or any other nasties. Comfort - our bed was really comfortable. As well as a ceiling fan, we had a powerful air conditioner. Shower was strong and hot. Staff - all v helpful and courteous. Happy to provide extra towels, adjust the TV, book cabs etc. Available 24hours. One night the people in the room next to us were having some sort of drunken party. The night staff were quick to keep them in check when we complained. Price - excellent value. Decor - clean, modern and functional. Safe - staff were available at all times and the entrance was well lit. CONS: Small rooms - no wardrobe, although a hanging rail is provided and plenty of drawer space. Noise - not a place to go for peace and quiet (but then again, where is in central New York?!!). We stayed in room 220. Noise from the bar/ club below was audible but didn't bother us too much with the windows closed and the air con on. TV - aerial didn't work well so poor reception and few channels available. No lift and the stairs are steep. Not a place for people with impaired mobility.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: drbongo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly situated for our visit to NYU and the Lower East Side Film Festival. Good value, safe and convenient to all sorts of things on foot.

Reviews.Title: “forget about this one”
Reviews.Author: forgetaboutit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lousy from the minute we stepped into the lobby. With spilled food and beverage on the floor to a 30 minute wait at 11:30pm at night just to get into our dank little room on the fourth floor where we had to shlepp four very heavy pieces of luggage. They moved me three times in six days. The second room electrical system went out five times and that was just when I was there. Though the staff was courteous, they were totally incompetent! I will never stay there again, nor advise anyone to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: SuziBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in Sohotel on a very hot summer night, the room was clean, had attractive furniture and the ceiling fan kept us cool. We kept the windows closed to decrease the outside noise. We asked to be "upgraded" if possible, but still paid the lower price, I am not sure if this had anthing to do with it. If you stay try to stay on the same floor as the front desk. The hotel is on the border of SOHO, Little Italy and Chinatown. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Bed bug reviews are accurate! Heed advice and stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: couldberaining
Reviews.Content: I arrived in the evening to a somewhat pleasant staff who barely spoke english. I was given a tiny room - which was fine as I wasn't planning on spending much time in it. Although I must say I was a bit surprised that the room didn't even have a telephone! While I was trying to sleep, I noticed something out of the corner of my eye moving. I turned on the light to find a small reddish bug. The hotel is old and a few bugs is to be expected. I got some kleenex and picked it up. Before jumping back into bed however, I pulled the covers back to make sure there wasn't any more. What I discovered was horrifying!! There were a couple dozen bugs crawing under the covers and along the rim of the bed/mattress. I panicked and immediately packed my stuff and went down to the front desk and told the staff who looked absolutely shocked and surprised at my discovery. After the other reviews on this board, it is clear they were putting on a "good show" of disbelief! They moved me to another room that I picked apart from top to bottom. While I didn't find any bugs, I didn't sleep either. I kept the light on because I researched bed bugs on my laptop and it said they don't come out when its light. Not immediately, but two days later, red bumps appeared on my arms, hands, neck and feet - the areas that were exposed during the night. They itched like crazy and stayed on me for well over two weeks. I advise anyone who is "sitting on the fence" on this hotel to really heed the reviews of this board as they are indeed accurate and truthful. I understand that the price of this hotel is appealing when it is so hard to find any others in Manhattan that come close. But there is a resaon for their "low price" - its a bug infested dirty place! Is it worth your HEALTH just to save a buck? The choice I made to stay really put a damper on the rest of my vacation, dont' let it hamper yours.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient, reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: Maxatone
Reviews.Content: Hotel management team courteous efficient and friendly, only too pleased to move us to a quiet, better room due to noisy interior work being carried out above our original room. Linen changed daily, maid service very efficient. A conveniently situated Hotel at most reasonable rates. Can recommend room 210 Would certainly make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Sohotel”
