Reviews.Author: boomshanka9
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some of these negative reviews of the Sohotel. I just returned home from a wonderful three days in New York and the Sohotel certainly enhanced my experience. The location is fab if lower Manhatten is your thing. Situated in Little Italy and spitting distance from Chinatown, you can easily explore all the funky little hidden streets and places that make this part of New York so interesting. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Also, my room wasn't huge but it was clean and very comfortable. The decor wasn't the overdone floral mess you see in posh hotels but was simple and elegant with the brick walls , antique headboards and quilts. I find it funny in some of these reviews how people mention the noise and lack of sleep. Well, come on people. It is New York for crying out loud and they don't call it "the city that never sleeps" for no reason. I slept quite well in my room and would have slept much later if it hadn't been for my jet lag. I could slightly hear various sounds but that's what you get in an old building. Part of the joy of visiting New York is the constant momentum of its energy. I would much rather stay in the Sohotel and experience real people and fantastic places than wall myself into some 5 star establishment that costs too much and has zero personality.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: emma628
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be clean and quiet. If you're planning to be out and about most of the time, this would be a good place to stay. The room was small, clean and air conditioned, had bathroom with shower. No phone but pay phones were in the lobby. The t.v. had rabbit ears, but pulled in a decent number of stations, some clearly, some not so clear. Close proximity to East Village, Chinatown, subways. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Try to sleep tight with bed bugs biting”
Reviews.Author: anjuta
Reviews.Content: What a terrible experience. in our tiny room with almost no light we first sow a mouse, then in the bathroom we spotted a couple of small cockroaches. We told the front desk about that, they have sprayed something in the room. But this was not all! After staying at the hotel for 4 nights i came home with lots of bumps all over my body. I thought those were mosquitos, but after doing some research on the internet, i realised that the small cockroach looking bugs i saw in the room were actually bed bugs! What a terrible thing! Now i'm all scared that i brought those creatures back to my home! What if they traveled with me in my clothes or in the laggage? Anyway, do not stay there, it is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Ear plugs or lots of Beer required”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to get a good nights sleep this is not the place to stay. The sohotel is one of the oldest Hotels in NY & it appears it still has its original plumbing! The pipes are very noisy & I would compare the constant noise to that of having a toilet flushed next to your bed all through the night. This hotel may be cheap but u will regret not paying more!

Reviews.Title: “New Yorks Best Buy in Hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Certainly would recommend this hotel if you get one of the newer rooms. The price was right and rooms were clean and pleasant. Also the location was near Chinatown and Little Italy and you could go out safely at night and have a nice walking tour or find a place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Its fine if you don't mind sleeping with cockroaches and bad service. The place has tiny cramped rooms. Do yourself a big favor and spend a few dollars more and get a room without bugs in a quieter, safer and cleaner neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “We had a pretty good experience!”
Reviews.Author: -CarmenNg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after Times Square Beds and Rooms. Moved for convenience of location to explore lower Manhattan. Sohotel was undergoing renovations when we stayed there.Combination of old and new charm! We stayed in a newly renovated room. Saw other rooms undergoing renos. No bed bugs. (Didn't see anything like that). I guess we were really lucky and had a really great experience because we didn't have any serious problems. Found a used matchstick on the floor (not ours). But room didn't smell of smoke! Talked to a resident who lives down the block and was rather skeptical of the hotel. But we had a very safe, and positive experience despite other reviews on this board. We were there April 11 & 12. Street noise could be muffled by turning on the bedroom fan. But turning it on would make the room really cold and almost 'windy'! Bathroom was small, but clean. Clean white towels. It'd take a while for the hot water to start running though... there was a communal bathroom outside our door, but we were fine. No elevator, so hauling luggage up/down stairs was a bit tricky! Location is great! Easy to hail a cab! Pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “dont miss the deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: if you looking for a budget hotel this is the place to be clean hptel great location good price good service safe 'very dood location'

Reviews.Title: “Visit the Sohotel! Great Buy!”
Reviews.Author: Johnnish
Reviews.Content: The Sohotel is a great buy for the buck. The cheapest hotel I could find. The location is absolutely fantastic. The Sohotel is bordering China Town, Little Italy, NoHo, SoHo, and is walking distance from Broadway. When I arrived I was greeted kindly by the front desk staff and a gentleman even offered to help with my bag as I was struggling with it. The Sohotel was very clean, I constantly saw people cleaning the lobby and other parts of the hotel. I would definitely return to The Sohotel and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “a few tips”
Reviews.Author: beachbabeiwish
Reviews.Content: After looking around for a cheap hotel in New York i came across the Sohotel, and after reading the reviews i was not sure what to ecpect. However after changing rooms from a very small room on the second floor right next to the stairs to a room on the fouth floor I was nicely surprised. The room was clean with clean towels and fresh bedlinin every day and no signs of cockroaches. The hot water was always hot/warm depending on what time you took a shower, my top tip is to have one before 830. My only complaint was that the room did not have any windows which ment it felt a bit like a prision cell and you had to make a trip to the window at the end of the hall to have a look at the weather for the day. The hotel was in a good location excellent for resturants and bars and also for shopping and for seeeing the sights of lower manhatten. It also had good transport links with three easy to reach stations. If you are coming from JFK, then you should really get of at Bowery street and not Grand street as the hotel recomends as this station is closer. The staff were always friendly and i did not have any problems with leaving things in the safe and they had a special room to keep luggage. As with most things in life you get what you pay for, but if your looking for a cheap hotel in manhatten and your going to be out sight seeing or shopping all day (we were always gone by nine) then the sohotel could be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the BED BUGS Bite!!”
Reviews.Author: Bigb0919
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted a really inexpensive Hotel just to crash. I read all the reviews and all the hotels around our price range: $100-$130 a night I chose the SOHOTEL, number 1 reason, NO Shared Bathroom! I stayed in room 427 Here are my comments: 1. Small rooms but very economical. 2. Price was reasonable for the Hotel. 3. Not for those with physical disabilities - No elevator, alot of stairs 4. Friendly staff 5. Room Key card had to be reset everyday 6. BRING Earplugs if you need quiet to sleep 7. Convenient location, subway not too far 8. Some nice inexpensive sub shops/restaurants nearby 9. They were remodeling the entire 3rd floor, with even flat screen plasma tvs! MY BIGGEST COMPLAINT AND BEWARE!!!!! As soon as I got home. This TICK jumped off my shirt that was in my clothes bag. Okay I THOUGHT it was a TICK! A few days after staying here, my boyfriend and I had bumps from head to toe all of our bodies. These itchy bumps that looked almost like pimples or mosquito bites! THEY WERE BED BUG BITES! IT WASN'T A TICK THAT JUMPED OFF MY SHIRT, IT WAS A MATURE ADULT BED BUG!!! Our hotel room was infested. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE, IF You want to stay at this hotel, I recommend reading up on bed bugs and following the guides in searching for them. This was the most uncomfortable feeling ever. I also had to fumicate my house, I bought allergen mattress and pillow case covers and washed all my sheets in bleach and hot water when I got home because I didn't want to get infested. This has become an epidemic in NYC. Check out 60 minutes from CBS, They did a special on it. GOOD NEWS. I did call the Hotel and complained and they did provide me with a full refund of my stay. And so far, looks like if I brought any of these critters home with me, I killed them all! I will add photos to this of the room when I get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Too small but good location”
Reviews.Author: coconino188
Reviews.Content: I like Sohotel location, when you get out of the hotel, you are within walking distance from Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, and train station. But the room is toooooo small, we are lucky to be petite to squeeze into one full size bed. We lived in a room with a private bathroom (thank god) and the bathroom is quite small too. The room has a tv but no telephone. No study desk or anything. One thing I must say is that the hotel did very good upkeep to make the room clean and comfortable. The wall is thin. You can hear people walking in the hallway -- especially when they walk in heels, they will wake you up. I wish I could have shopped around more or pay more for a bigger room. Overall, this is a good hotel if you have low budget.

Reviews.Title: “good for my budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i am not a rech man but i spend money when i can aforded and to be in new york who is one of the most expensive city of the world the sohotel was perfect for me clean dood service. free coffe in the morning. best location. safe. what else you can ask for 138.42 including taxes all others are over 230 dollars a night, i had no complaints. clean room.

Reviews.Title: “great stay great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great location near soho and little italy public trasport i tried the sohotel despite some bed reviews i was realy suprised a hotel is not 5 stars but clean nice staff ,they change fresh towel daily and the leenens to. we paid 149.75 a night,and we received high value for our money

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bedbugs bite!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine5437
Reviews.Content: At first glance this hotel seems cute and cozy. I probably could have dealt with the rooms, which are on the tiny side, and totally reek of cigarettes. However, the reviewer who noticed bedbugs was not kidding. I didn't find just one or two, there were probably over 25 in the seams of my mattress!! I squished one and blood popped out if it! I had just got there so I know it wasn't mine! I don't even want to think about all the diseases I could've gotten from that one little bug. (For those of you, who have never seen bedbugs: http://medent.usyd.edu.au/fact/bedbugs.html. They are not small little things when they are full grown. In fact they're quite scary looking.) I also asked to switch rooms (which they weren't too happy about). When finally settled in what I hoped was a clean room, needless to say I did not have a good night's sleep. I was a bit claustrophobic (I was switched to a smaller room because it was supposedly the only one they had), paranoid about the bedbugs, and the fact you can hear EVERY noise in and around that building, this includes the clanking of the heater in your own room, this did not make for a peaceful sleep. The price is great, but now I know why...

Reviews.Title: “above avrage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at sohotel and i was saprized for the high cleanness of the hotel polite staff. Great location recently renovated hotel you get a high value for your money. I would highly recomend this hotel for anyone staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Infestation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not reccomend this hotel because my husband and I found bed bugs. First, we noticed them in the cracks of the walls. Then, I tore off the mattress cover and saw an infestation of them in the seams on both beds. We asked for a room switch after telling the problem to the front desk. They were very 'hush hush' about it, and agreed to change our room. We were given no discount or courtesy credit, which was I didn't think was the mark of a good business. They acted like they'd never experienced that problem before, but I doubt it by the way they were behaving. Our second room was noisy, the light in the bathroom had an overbearing buzz and the traffic outside was awful, even with our windows closed. We might as well have been sleeping on the streets. Also, this hotel would not be good for anyone with walking problems, as there is no elevator! If you get a room on the fourth floor and you have a lot of luggage, you must walk it up yourself. Please, do yourself a favor and do not stay here. While the location may be great, you deserve cleaner rooms and better service for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Sohotel has gone upmarket...”
Reviews.Author: dercoss
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sohotel (or Pioneer) many times over the past 8 years and have always found it to be excellent value for money. My recent visit was just as good as previous trips. It's not 5 star accommodation but then it doesn't pretend to be.. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel has undergone something of a refit. The lobby is much more welcoming than before and the room I stayed in had been completely renovated. The decor was much better, the shower/toilet was of a much higher standard and even the tv looked fairly new and actually had a remote... The doors open with a credit card device rather than a key and seem very secure. I don't know if the whole hotel has been refitted yet but those on the first floor (the same level as the lobby) seemed to have been. The prices have gone up a little but are still excellent value. I always stay here when I visit New York and would recommend it highly to those on a budget.. Regarding noise... Bring earplugs.. I always do this in any hotel regardless of cost. Hotels are noisy places wherever they are. Also, why come to Manhattan, one of the liveliest places in the world and then moan about the noise?? The only other hotel that compares for value is the Pickwick Arms on 51st Street who have some excellent rooms for $80 plus tax..

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read more "not-so-glowing" reviews than assuring ones from various sites on Pioneer Sohotel, but due to last minute planning, we had no choice but to settle with Pioneer Sohotel as it was the only budget hotel 1, located in Manhattan 2, near a sub and 3, has a room available to us. Upon arriving at the hotel, I was worried about encountering the unpleasantries I read online - namely loud noise from disco on first floor, roaches under bed, stained and paper-thin towels, and unreliable hot shower. None of these happened to us. We (my partner joined me later in the night after he rushed down from a conference in another state of USA) stayed on the second floor but there was no loud music throughout the 5nights we stayed there. The hygiene level was superb. Room was spic and span. No roaches, or any crawlies, throughout our stay. And that's not just the room, even the lobby and corridor (on the second floor where we stayed) was clean and well-sanitised (every night when I stepped into the hotel and walked up the stairs, I could "smell dettol" instantly) And towels were clean, fresh-smelled and decent. Not paper-thin. Only upon my scrutiny did I notice one towel with faint tiny stains; but it was clearly a well-washed, clean towel. And the room attendant was so generous with the towels: we had 4pieces of towel on the first night, she removed 2 used ones the next day and issued another 4 clean peices to us. At the end of our stay, there was a heap of clean towels in our room. Hot showers was a no-issue too. It was end Nov (cold) and getting hot showers was important to me. So particular and paronoid was I over what I read online (unreliable hot showers) that I specifically tested the shower the moment I checked into the room. As it was an old building, it wasn't an electric heater hence would take a while for the hot water to flow out. I didn't get hot waters out at first try, so I went to the reception counter to enquire and after returning back to my room, within minutes, they got a "technical" young chap knocking on my door to check it. It was fine, we got nice warm showers throughout our stay. One warning to those who intend to book through travelocity though. We booked 5 nights through travelocity, the booking was confirmed but upon checking-in at the hotel, it was discovered that the hotel's system registered my booking as 1 night stay. All thanks to Marco's (think he is the manager or boss) quick problem-solving on the spot, he got some bookings resorted and found a room available on the 5 nights we were in NY. Jose, who attended to me, was nice and gave me assurance that they'd get the arrangement iron out when he realised the discrepancy in records. From his exclamation "oh no, it's happening again", I took it that the hotel's system and travelocity's system do not "talk to each other" in sync. So take note there, I'll advise you to make a call to the hotel to re-confirm your booking after booking through travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - but beware of noisy water pipes!”
Reviews.Author: Pernille_HK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the SoHotel for eight days in the beginning of December and were fairly satisfied with the hotel. We booked a category E room, and the room was surprisingly large and clean. Make sure to get a room away from the lobby, though! The doors will let any noise through, and especially room no. 209 and 211 suffer from the noise caused by the front door slamming, guests chatting in the lobby, the lobby phone ringing e.g. Another inconvenience was the water pipes. It seems that the heating season may have begun during our stay. Anyhow, a couple of days into our stay the water pipes and the radiator began making squeaking, bubbly, and really loud noises late at night! Taken together, I would definitely recommend the SoHotel to students and budget travellers. It's value for money, and it's really well situated in Chinatown, close to the subway, restaurants, and buzz of New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Good for young travelers, great price, not bad at all.”
Reviews.Author: obiwanda
Reviews.Content: I think the Sohotel is great for young budget travelers who are no-frills and need a clean, centrally-located place to stay. The hotel wasn't bad at all, especially for the price- $139 for a Saturday night in New York City. It was this or the Ramada Inn in Jersey City, and I definitely think this was the better choice. We were down the street from all the great eateries in Little Italy, close Chinatown, near cute shops in Soho, and near the subway. My friend and I stayed in a room on the third floor with 2 double beds and private bathroom. The room was medium sized, and had a dresser, nightstands, and coat rack to hang our clothes on. The furniture and bathroom fixtures all looked pretty new and were actually quite cute. Overall, the room seemed clean, although I might recommend BYOP- Bring Your Own Pillowcase...there were a couple of stray hairs on mine. Nothing too major, just pulled them off and turned the pillow over, but not too appealing either. The bedding wasn't five star or anything, but it was good enough, and we slept fine. The front desk staff were polite and helpful. Shame on the judgmental reviewer who said they looked like drug addicts- young with tattoos is hip nowadays, you know. Although I will say the hotel could probably pick out more stylish uniforms- the janitors garbs aren't too fashionable. Anyways, I really appreciated the help of the front desk, the staff there gave me good directions to the subway and genuinely seemed to be looking out for my well-being. Check-in and check-out didn't take too long, and my credit card was billed correctly. The only other thing I would mention is that there is some noise because the walls are not particularly thick. We slept in until about 10am and heard folks shutting their doors and walking down the halls to the lobby, but it wasn't a big deal to us. If you like a lot of quiet or are a light sleeper, earplugs would probably solve this problem. Overall, I ranked this hotel a 3, it wasn't anything spectacular, but the price was great and it wasn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Bar is a benefit!”
Reviews.Author: rah123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple weeks ago and were actually quite impressed. Other hotels in the area were more than 4 times the price. It is obviously not as nice as those places but who really spends a ton of time in their hotel anyway? We liked having the bar downstairs, it was a great place to go for drinks before and after dinner. The hotel itself does not have a bar or restaurant, but this made it feel like it did. The hotel was clean, rooms were small and served their purpose. As far as noise, I have stayed in some really expensive places in NY and this hotel was quieter. After all people, what do you expect - We are in NEW YORK CITY!!

Reviews.Title: “don't risk it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DONT STAY HERE! Read why... We stayed here in december, on our second day we returned to our room and couldnt get in, the hotel had put other people in there (2 girls who looked like they were on crack). Excuse:'double booking'. They moved all our belongings that had been in the room/bathroom into bin bags in a storage room! They moved us to an (identical) room a few doors down. When we eventually recieved our stuff back several items had gone 'missing'. The NYPD weren't surprised when we reported it, the place has a bad reputation, 'is not what we'd call a hotel'. There are drug users/thiefs/prostitutes at this 'hotel', the management are utterly useless, apart from that, yes it is a good location, cheap, and cleanish. Don't risk ruining your holiday, spend 50 bucks extra and stay somewhere decent. (try off Soho suites down the road)

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation for a bargain price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this website I have to say I was more than a little anxious about staying in this hotel. My partner and I were there for five days in November 2005. If you are looking for a decent budget hotel in New York City for a bargain price (in comparison to most other places) then this is the hotel for you. I've stayed in numerous hotels throughout New York that haven't been budget in the past, so i was very dubious, but we were both pleasantly surprised. The room was big and spacious. The sheets and towels were changed everyday. Really it was better than you would expect all round and the location is fantastic. The only problem was that you have to either have a boiling hot or freezing cold shower, and the bathroom is tiny - but really who cares, and what do you expect for the price? I will definetly stay there again in the future, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good value, only if you plan on sleeping after 3-4am”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Sohotel is where we ended up on our random trip to NYC. Once we arrived at the hotel we were impressed with the value for the money. I was travelling with three other friends and was delighted to see that there were three beds in the room and they made no fuss over visitors or additional guests in the room. We were put on the second floor which was the first floor of the hotel. There was a bar directly below us. We went out for the evenings living up the NYC nightlife and returned to our room nightly around 3am. We weren't aware of a nightclub directly below us prior to checking in, but the bass coming through the floor was so loud that we felt like we were in the club. I'm actually a bass lover, have subwoofers in my car and love going to loud nightclubs, but this bass was boooming, no exaggeration at all. For me and my friends we didn't really care since we weren't sleeping until after the club closed anyways, but for other travellers you will find it virtually impossible to sleep from the bass alone. If your a fan of house music, maybe it'll be paradise for you. I was impressed with the hotel overall for value but I agree with the last reviewer's review, only stay there if you are planning to go out late at night. They should probably adjust the housekeeping times to at least noon to account for people not being able to sleep through the bass. We had to tell housekeeping to go away. We missed our checkout time by about 3 hours, but blamed it on the nightclub below and they didn't charge us any extra. For us it was a good experience but be forewarned about the bass, it's insane!! I only recommend this to people who are only looking for a bed to crash in late at night after hitting up a club. One of my friends thought of the brilliant idea of buying booze for our hotel room, and going back and forth from our room to the club to drink. So if you're looking to do that, then you've found the place!!

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Bargan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a reaonable 'value' hotel. It is just about impossible to find a reaonably priced hotel in Manhattan. This hotel is about 1/2 the cost of other accomodations and has private full bathrooms in most of the rooms. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was a TV in the room, but no cable. That's OK as we didn't plan to spend very much time in the room. There is too much to do in the 'Big Apple". The only real drawback is that there is no elevator so request a room on the second floor and don't bring a lot of luggage. The Chinatown location is close to several subway lines and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: AliTee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our haven having left the crack den of the west side inn on the upper west side. It is clean, comfortable and affordable. It is in a great neighbourhood - you are a stone's throw away from little italy, soho and the crazy delights of chinatown. Nice liberal, multiracial neighbourhood - you quickly feel a part of it. If you stay in this hotel- bring your earplugs and eyepatches as it tended tobe very noisy - workmen smashing up the place, ridiculously loud clanging plumbing throughout the night, and at weekends the sounds of people shouting their way home through the night. Overall - a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Inexpensive Rooms, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, I couldn't expect better in this area of the city. The location is fantastic, and let's face it, who comes to NY to hang out in the room? The bed was clean and comfortable, and while the bathroom was not great (there was a lot of mold in the shower), it had hot water. The staff was really helpful as well, and there was hot coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: hlevenst
Reviews.Content: There's nothing good in this hotel. Dirty, painting falling down the wall and extremely noisy. For sure the smallest room and bath i've ever encountered in the world. At 6 am you won't be able to sleep anymore: hotel staff start to work and as the door don't close properly the noise become terrible. I've stayed in December and the heater warmed too much and there's no temperature control. Result: i were obligate to sleep with open window!!!!????!!!!! For the same price you'll find many better options.

Reviews.Title: “Not good, But tolerable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i was with a tour group going through the east coast of the US, and our stay in the sohotel (14/4 - 17/4) was somewhat interesting. half of the time there was no hot water, "renovation" was being done on the building, even though it didnt change during our stay, they had signs up notifying that water would be out between specific times. if you want to walk anywhere its a long walk to any of the major attractions, like the ferry to the statue of libertey, times square and the empire state building. and even though it is a couple of minutes walk from the subway, it can be confusing for a tourist to take the subway, our tour group got lost several times. i came back one night to find my luggage all messed up, as though it had been searched through. with that said, the rooms were clean enough, and the beds were comfortable, the tv needed tuning, but it worked. the staff did not TRY to make our stay comfortable, however they did meet any of what they thought were REASONABLE requests that we had

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhh!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you know whatâ€™s good for you, you won't stay at the Sohotel. Let me just mention a few thing... There were spiders on the toilet paper, no cable in the room, lets just say a closet was bigger than our room, and very early in the morning the fire alarm went off for no reason at all. And then when we asked them to turn it off they said that they couldn't so the fire alarm light was flashing all morning, try sleeping through that. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that for the most part it was clean. So if you're looking for a cheap room with a crazy adventure then you might like the Sohotel. I on the other hand will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “A comfort bed but no hot water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only thing I really ask for in a hotel is for it be clean, the bed be comfortable and to have a hot shower in the morning. Well this didn't happen at the Sohotel. We stayed 2 nights and the first morning we had a trickle of warm water in our shower and only warm after 15 minutes of running the water and then the next morning no hot water whatsoever, not even a trickle. We had friends staying at the same hotel and the same morning we had no hot water, there toilet wouldn't flush although they did have the trickle of hot water. When we were standing in the lobby to leave we heard the front desk tell someone they had 5 toilets backed up that morning. The beds were clean and comfortable and the rooms adequate but the water was a big problem and that had never been mentioned in any of your reviews. We will never stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “not as scary as the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Colborne
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was apprensive. In our usual travelling style we had made reservations and checked the reviews afterwards! Our group had three rooms on a Saturday night and we were all pleased. The rooms were clean with new bathrooms and linens, which was great for the price ($114 us). The rooms are very basic (no toiletries provided, a coat rack but no closet) but what do you expect for that price in Manhattan? We were in town to see the Gates in Central Park and found the hotel convenient for the subway. It was also very convenient for Canal street and Soho shopping. Parking was the biggest pain as garages were not plentiful in this part of town (we have always stayed in midtown before) Our room (333) overlooked Broome St and we could dimly hear the bar below, but it didn't keep us awake. Our friends had rooms in the low 300's away from the street and they said they were very quiet. The staff offers to let you see the room before you check in, which you should take advantage of if you are nervous. If you'd rather spend your money on food and shopping than a hotel room you're rarely in, this is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night break in NY with my boyfriend and had booked the sohotel for the entire stay on an american website before we left. the website quoted this hotel as a 3*. i had read the reviews on here before going and warned my boyfriend that i wasnt sure about it, but we decided to chance it anyway. on arriving at the sohotel we were given the chance to view the room, as it was 1.30am it was clean and we needed to sleep. on checking in the hotel required the full payment so we decided that we would only pay for 2 nights and see if we could sort something out in the morning. we were in room 221, above the bar! although it wasnt open on the thursday and we were very drunk on the friday so wouldnt remember if there was any noise! we managed to find another hotel in the morning and moved on the saturday morning to a great hotel near times square. i would say the sohotel is a bit dodgy, again suspect characters in the lobby (although i think they were staff!) police cars and bin lorries outside at 6am, the room was clean but could do with a few new pipes and flooring. the lock on the door was also questionable but we had no problems. apart from this the location was really good, only a few blocks from soho and some really cool shops and bars and not far from the financial district etc. i think at the end of the day you get what you pay for and 2 cheaper nights here meant we could spend a bit extra on our last 2 nights and got the best out of being in 2 different locations over the holiday. if your looking for luxury dont stay here, for a group of lads wanting a cheap base it would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Dicey at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a last minute 1 day trip to NYC, for which I refused to spend app $250/300 for a single nite (which was what I was coming up with in addition to striking out on Priceline), this place near the neighborhood I needed to be in came up for around $100 (which as a 10 year resident of the city I knew full well was way too cheap for Manhattan.) This neighborhood, now part of the spreading hipster zone as the East Village spreads downtown, is where many flophouses (or SROs) used to be - it's a few feet from the infamous Bowery. Draw your own conclusions on both of these observations. Room had been partially renovated, but still managed to be cheap and shoddy. And tiny (even by European standards.) Too small for two people, I'd say. Lobby a source of some concern. I would have hesitated to leave anything of value there, so was glad I didn't have to. Young solo travelers on a budget may enjoy being in this neighborhood, and not mind the marginal facilities and questionable neighbors. All others I'd advise great caution.
